text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that for tax years 2022-2024, interest deductibility under \u00a7163(j) is limited to earnings before interest and taxes (i.e., no depreciation or amortization add-back). The candidate answer discusses Section 163(j) generally, stating it limits deductibility to \"30 percent of adjusted taxable income,\" but it fails to specify the precise calculation of \"adjusted taxable income\" (ATI) for the 2022-2024 period, which is defined in the statute to exclude depreciation and amortization (i.e., it is calculated without regard to any deduction allowable for depreciation, amortization, or depletion). Since the response does not explicitly state the limitation is based on EBIT (or ATI calculated without depreciation/amortization add-back) for the specified years, it does not satisfy this specific, technical requirement of the rubric criterion.", "criterion_id": "3c8280f0-10b6-49d2-8467-4d1e817f8930"}
